text: Huseyn Hasanov (born 26 September 1986) is a Paralympian athlete from Azerbaijan competing mainly in T46 classification track and field events. Hasanov represented his country at the 2012 Summer Paralympics in London, where he competed in two events, the long jump and triple jump. He finished on the podium in the long jump, taking the bronze medal but was unable to improve on his first jump of 13.74 in the triple jump leaving him in fourth place. As well as Paralympic success, Hasanov has medaled at the IPC World Championships winning gold in the triple jump at the 2011 World Championships in Christchurch. Hasanov has been recognized several times by his country for services to athletics. In 2009 he was named Paralympic Athlete of the Year in Azerbaijan, and after winning his Paralympic bronze mdalin London he was awarded the Taraggi Medal by then president Ilham Aliyev. ==Notes== Category:Paralympic athletes of Azerbaijan Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Azerbaijan Category:Living people Category:1986 births Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:Azerbaijani male long jumpers Category:Azerbaijani male triple jumpers Category:Sportspeople from Baku Category:Recipients of the Tereggi Medal Category:Paralympic medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Huseyn Hasanov
